technology.name: State Troop Sergeants
technology.description: Regimental sergeants in Elector Count armies are made of stern stuff. They are veterans of many battles and have probably seen things that would turn the stomachs of the average man. Such bravery sees them rise in the ranks, leading regiments and steeling their men when wavering or barking orders in the midst of battle. The Empire needs men like these, but the very nature of their occupation means they are rare souls indeed.

technology.name: State Troop Standards
technology.description: Some regimental standards are hundreds of years old - physical representations of their regiments, even as members join and die in battle, or - if they are lucky - are relieved of duty and sent back to their old lives with a modest pension. The latter is rare, for there are always wars to fight for the Empire and for Sigmar!

technology.name: State Troop Musicians
technology.description: Regimental musicians play drums, horns, or maybe other, more exotic instruments. There are plenty of examples throughout history; the Wolfenburg Jaegers, for example, had a flautist who played an instrument made from the arm bone of a Catrazzian Birdman. In any case, a musician is there to play a tune to keep the men in time and boost their morale.

technology.name: Interpreting the Old Ones' Meaning
technology.description: Correct interpretation is essential if the Great Plan is to be executed to the Old Ones' intended design.

technology.name: Supply Wagons
technology.description: Wagons crammed with supplies and looked after by stern and bearded quartermasters follow in an army's wake, enabling it to range further from home and ensure that it is fed and watered. Such wagon trains also need protection, of course, for while allowing armies a longer leash, that same leash can easily be cut if exposed to the enemy.

technology.name: Volley Fire
technology.description: An Imperial crossbow and handgunner regiment is a formidable force. Some eagle-eyed members can pick off a noble's plume at a hundred and twenty paces with their crossbows, yet the secret of volley fire is not range nor even sight of the target, but firing as one into the sky to rain a hail of death upon the unfortunate enemy.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +15% for missile infantry units
Reload time reduction: +15% for Pistoliers and Outriders units

technology.name: Determining the Great Plan
technology.description: There are many paths to order and knowledge; may the Old Ones guide us.

technology.name: Tablet of Spawning
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -5% for Skink and Chameleon Skinks units

technology.name: Sequence of Skink Spawning
technology.description: The above-ground spawning pools must be prepared; new Skinks will be required if the Plan is to be interpreted on schedule.

technology.name: Sequence of Saurus Spawning
technology.description: Those spawning pools located underground must be ready - war is always at hand and fresh Saurus will be needed to fight.

technology.name: Sequence of Enhanced Instinct
technology.description: These directions ensure sufficient numbers of beast-sensitives among Skink and Saurus spawnings.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Recruit rank: +2 for Cold One units
Recruit rank: +2 for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units

technology.name: Sequence of Creature Bonding
technology.description: The bond between beast and rider must not be underestimated.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Ancient Salamander and Dread Saurian units

technology.name: Sequence of Guardian Spawning
technology.description: A near-constant state of war should not prevent the construction or management of the temple-cities.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Recruit rank: +2 for Temple Guards units

technology.name: Sequence of Strengthening
technology.description: Those Lizardmen destined for leadership roles have exotic skin-markings.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

technology.name: Tablet of War
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

technology.name: Sequence of Stoicism
technology.description: The wisest race is indifferent to pain and fortune's many vicissitudes.

technology.name: Sequence of Marching
technology.description: Lizardmen do not tire easily - this sequence ensures that all Saurus spawnings have the required stamina.

technology.name: Sequence of Utilitarianism
technology.description: Individual lives are of little importance; in the final analysis only the Great Plan matters.

technology.name: Sequence of Annihilation
technology.description: Those who dare to remove the Old Ones' precious legacy from their sacred sites will be obliterated from the face of the world.

technology.name: Sequence of Absolute Obedience
technology.description: Compliance without question ensures that the path to the Great Plan remains as clear as possible.

technology.name: Sequence of Geomantic Healing
technology.description: Energy can be siphoned from the Geomantic Web to heal or teleport reinforcements to where they are needed most.

technology.name: Tablet of Order
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

technology.name: Sequence of Scrying
technology.description: By which the Old Ones' agents may be guided remotely, greatly increasing their chances of success.

technology.name: Sequence of Civilisation
technology.description: Understanding of the Great Plan involves the realisation that others have a role to play.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +5 with High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.name: Sequence of Protection
technology.description: The insidious taint and corruption of destruction's dark forces must be kept at bay.

technology.name: Sequence of Infiltration
technology.description: The ability to remain hidden almost anywhere is vital if the foe's intrigues are to be discovered and frustrated.

technology.name: Sequence of Purification
technology.description: Disturbances in the Geomantic Web are detected long before they become viable threats, enabling their sources to be found and purged accordingly.

technology.name: Sequence of Projected Presence
technology.description: It is possible for the Slann to communicate telepathically with their agents in the field, and send visions to guide their hands.

technology.name: Tablet of Monuments
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

technology.name: Sequence of the City
technology.description: Every plaza, every ziggurat, every stone - each element must be laid out exactly as the Old Ones decreed.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.name: Sequence of Construction
technology.description: The combination of magical dexterity and the Kroxigors' immense physical strength reduces construction times considerably.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.name: Sequence of Expansion
technology.description: Once new temple-cities are fully connected to the Geomantic Web, future spawnings will be accelerated.

technology.name: Sequence of the Great Temples
technology.description: The revered Old Ones must be venerated whenever possible.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Cult of Sotek and Cult of the Old Ones buildings
Construction time: -1 for Cult of Sotek and Cult of the Old Ones buildings

technology.name: Sequence of the Star Chambers
technology.description: Within the Star Chambers, the Slann meditate and plan the future of their race.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Star Chamber buildings
Construction time: -1 for Star Chamber buildings

technology.name: Sequence of the Global Plan
technology.description: The Plan requires that all Lizardmen factions work together for the betterment of the entire race.

effects.description: Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units

technology.name: Tablet of Crafts
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

technology.name: Sequence of the Artisan
technology.description: A strict schedule from which the Skinks work to ensure the Great Plan is carried out.

technology.name: Sequence of Exploitation
technology.description: The world's natural resources are a gift from the Old Ones for the benefit of their race.

technology.name: Sequence of Coexistence
technology.description: Only those among the younger races whose existence adheres to the tenets of the Great Plan are permitted.

technology.name: Sequence of the Sea
technology.description: Although the sea is not generally their habitat, amphibious Lizardmen are  used to traverse the hazardous waters when the need arises.

technology.name: Sequence of the Labourers
technology.description: The bigger, stronger, simpler Lizardmen do much of the physical labour in their society.

technology.name: Sequence of Geological Prospecting
technology.description: Geomancy can be used to locate the best ore veins, ripe for exploitation.

technology.name: Tablet of the Skinks
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

effects.description: Enables poison attacks for all Skink infantry

technology.name: Sequence of Skirmishing
technology.description: Skink warriors are lightly armoured and best-used for skirmish duties in battle.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Skink, Chameleon Skink and Chameleon Stalker units
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for all Skink infantry

technology.name: Sequence of Purpose
technology.description: Whereby Skinks are trained for battle, focusing on use of their natural agility to damage the foe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Chameleon Stalker and Red Crested Skink units

technology.name: Sequence of Skink Invigoration
technology.description: Of the myriad jungle plants, some are poisonous while others stimulate and rejuvenate the Skinks.

technology.name: Sequence of Quickness
technology.description: Speed and dexterity on the battlefield are the watchwords here.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Chameleon Stalker and Red Crested Skink units
Melee defence: +3 for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Chameleon Stalker and Red Crested Skink units

technology.name: Sequence of the Kroxigor
technology.description: As some of the strongest Lizardmen, Kroxigor use their bulk to charge and smash through enemy ranks.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Charge bonus: +10 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

technology.name: Sequence of Hardened Scales
technology.description: By the application of natural sap, the armoured bulk of the Kroxigor can be further strengthened so they survive longer in battle.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

technology.name: Tablet of the Saurus
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

technology.name: Sequence of Weapon Crafting
technology.description: This sequence further improves the process of weapon manufacture, ensuring that the Saurus have the very best equipment with which to fight.

technology.name: Sequence of Massed Combat
technology.description: Each spawning of Saurus act as one on the battlefield, acting in a perfectly coordinated manner to crush the enemies of the Old Ones.

technology.name: Sequence of Saurus Invigoration
technology.description: Of the myriad jungle plants, some are poisonous while others stimulate and rejuvenate the Saurus.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Saurus Infantry and Temple Guard units

technology.name: Sequence of Armour Crafting
technology.description: Gold, found in abundance in Lustria, is used to fashion exquisite armour to cover those parts the Lizardmen's tough scales do not.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Saurus and Temple Guard units

technology.name: Sequence of the Honoured Guardians
technology.description: The most respected of all Saurus Warriors, the Temple Guard are equipped with the finest arms and armour available.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Temple Guards units

technology.name: Sequence of Martial Excellence
technology.description: The Temple Guard, veterans all and many thousands of years old, are a pinnacle to which all Saurus aspire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Temple Guards units
Melee defence: +5 for Temple Guards units

technology.name: Tablet of Beasts
technology.description: As described by the Old Ones, research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan to its ultimate conclusion.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Speed: +10% for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units

technology.name: Sequence of Exotic Weapons
technology.description: The most irregular weapons are reserved for Terradon Riders, who are armed with poison-tipped javelins, fireleech bolas, and various other unusual ordnances.

technology.name: Sequence of the Ferocity
technology.description: The ferocious, predatory Cold Ones can be trained so their savage natures are exploited to the Lizardmen's best advantage.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Cold One units

technology.name: Sequence of the Hunt
technology.description: Once the foe's blood begins to flow the Cold Ones go into near-uncontrollable frenzy.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Cold One units
Melee attack: +5 for Cold One units

technology.name: Sequence of the Great Beast's Resilience
technology.description: Slow-moving but deadly, the Living Bastions of Lustria's armies can be made even tougher by following the Old Ones' teachings.

technology.name: Sequence of the Great Beast's Rampage
technology.description: It's best to stay out of a Stegadon's way if you don't want to be trampled or gored, no matter whose side you are on.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Stegadon, Carnosaur, Troglodon and Dread Saurian units
Charge bonus: +15 for Stegadon, Carnosaur, Troglodon and Dread Saurian units

technology.name: Sequence of the Beastkeepers
technology.description: Fresh quadruped 'recruits' are always required when war comes to Lustria's jungle shores.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Packs, Cold Ones, Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Carnosaur, Coatl, Troglodon and Dread Saurian units
